intro: Microlicia macaubensis, commonly known as the Macaubé tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Atlantic Forest region of eastern Brazil, where it thrives in humid, tropical climates. The plant is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks, contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and is of interest for conservation efforts.
